message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.DS 

This paper discusses the integration of blockchain technology with hardware security primitives to address security and privacy issues in the Internet-of-Everything (IoE) environment. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Other likely sub-categories include cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) as the paper discusses the challenges of scalability and latency in the IoE environment and proposes a new consensus algorithm. The paper also discusses data management and storage, which falls under the sub-category of cs.SE (Software Engineering). Finally, the paper proposes a new blockchain architecture and consensus algorithm, which involves the use of physical unclonable functions (PUFs), a topic that falls under the sub-category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
